presetPlanItem.description: 1. Identify the suitable data mining approach to be used for model building, based on the type of the process objectives defined in phase 1 and in light of the discussion in section 3.2.

customisedPlanItem.description: 1. Identify the suitable data mining approach to be used for model building, based on the type of the process objectives defined in phase 1 and in light of the discussion in section 3.2.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.

presetPlanItem.description: 2. Match the process objective to the data mining goals and tasks, which are illustrated in figure 3.2(see section 3.3).

customisedPlanItem.description: 2. Match the process objective to the data mining goals and tasks, which are illustrated in figure 3.2(see section 3.3).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).

presetPlanItem.description: 3. Match the process objective to the available data mining techniques using the illustration in table 3.1), and taking into consideration the results of data exploration phase regarding the nature, quality, and potential of the targeted data.

customisedPlanItem.description: 3. Match the process objective to the available data mining techniques using the illustration in table 3.1), and taking into consideration the results of data exploration phase regarding the nature, quality, and potential of the targeted data.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).

presetPlanItem.description: 4. Based on the steps 1-3, select the data mining technique that would fulfil the defined objectives and suit the targeted data.

customisedPlanItem.description: 4. Based on the steps 1-3, select the data mining technique that would fulfil the defined objectives and suit the targeted data.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Selecting the data mining technique(s) that fulfil the defined process objectives and suit the targeted metabolomics data.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).

presetPlanItem.description: 5. Identify the resources, which are required for applying the selected technique, e.g. software , hardware, expertise, etc.

customisedPlanItem.description: 5. Identify the resources, which are required for applying the selected technique, e.g. software , hardware, expertise, etc.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 5. The application of the selected technique must be feasible, and it must consider the process management constraints and available resources.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The application of the selected technique must be feasible, and it must consider the process management constraints and available resources.

presetPlanItem.description: 6. Perform the following assessments on the candidate technique: (a) Assess the potential fulfilment of the defined process objectives by the candidate technique; (b) Assess the suitability of the candidate technique to the nature and quality of the data, as well as to its trends and expected patterns, based on the results of phase 3; (c) Assess the intense of the acclimatisation activities, which are required by the candidate technique; (d) Assess the availability of the resources required for applying the candidate technique; (e) Assess the feasibility of the application of the candidate technique; In the case of the candidate techniques failure in assessments in step 6, consider selecting an alternative technique by repeating the steps 4-6.

customisedPlanItem.description: 6. Perform the following assessments on the candidate technique: (a) Assess the potential fulfilment of the defined process objectives by the candidate technique; (b) Assess the suitability of the candidate technique to the nature and quality of the data, as well as to its trends and expected patterns, based on the results of phase 3; (c) Assess the intense of the acclimatisation activities, which are required by the candidate technique; (d) Assess the availability of the resources required for applying the candidate technique; (e) Assess the feasibility of the application of the candidate technique; In the case of the candidate techniques failure in assessments in step 6, consider selecting an alternative technique by repeating the steps 4-6.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The selection procedures must be comprehensive and unbiased, and it must cover all possible data mining techniques (see section 3.4).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 5. The application of the selected technique must be feasible, and it must consider the process management constraints and available resources.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The application of the selected technique must be feasible, and it must consider the process management constraints and available resources.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.

presetPlanItem.description: 7. Identify the performance measurements, which are applicable to the selected technique, e.g. accuracy, sensitivity, precision, specificity, etc.

customisedPlanItem.description: 7. Identify the performance measurements, which are applicable to the selected technique, e.g. accuracy, sensitivity, precision, specificity, etc.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. The selected technique performance must be measurable in model evaluation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. The selected technique performance must be measurable in model evaluation.

presetPlanItem.description: 8. Define the success criteria, based on the identify measurement.

customisedPlanItem.description: 8. Define the success criteria, based on the identify measurement.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The selected technique must have the potential to achieve the defined process ob- jective.

presetPlanItem.description: 9. Define a mechanism for applying the selected modelling technique, considering its required resources identified in 5 and assessed in 6.

customisedPlanItem.description: 9. Define a mechanism for applying the selected modelling technique, considering its required resources identified in 5 and assessed in 6.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 7. The selection strategy must be flexible and adjustable and consider the selection of alternative techniques in the case of feedback or iteration.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 7. The selection strategy must be flexible and adjustable and consider the selection of alternative techniques in the case of feedback or iteration.

objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The application of the selected technique must be feasible, and it must consider the process management constraints and available resources.
